result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Follow conditions as outlined in Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement, if complies will be dismissed.

Court calls  @ 3:47 pm.  Defendant Joseph M Renkas in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Review compliance on deferred agreement.  State received some proof but def. doesn't have valid D.L. off the record. back on the record. State will set for motion to revoke and sentencing and if def. has valid D.L. by Court date State will dismiss.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

Court calls  @ 2:07 pm.  Defendant Joseph M Renkas in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. didn't bring proof.  State will move to extend DEJ until next court date 10-22-18 @ 3:30.  Court will grant extend DEJ.  Def. makes statement.  Review hearing scheduled for October 22, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joseph M Renkas in court.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews court record and deferrred entry of judgment agreement.  Condition def was complete an AODA and state has not received any information.  Statement by def.  Off record.  Back on record.  State requesting an adjournment  Court will adjourn for 1 year for def to comply.  Review hearing scheduled for October 12, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
Review hearing on October 13, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Voucher, Petition and Order for Payment of Attorney fees with statement
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement

Defendant Joseph M Renkas in court with attorney Corey Mehlos.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 16CF26, 16TR148, 16TR149 @ 3:21 p.m. State authorized to appear on City of Antigo cases.  Atty Mehlos only appears on 16CF26. Agreement stated - State will amend ct 1 - 961.41(3g)(b) , Def will plead to amended charge, ct2 dismiss and read in. Ct 1 defer judgment 1 yr. Def will plead to OWI w/BAC .16 - $895.00, 7 month revocation, 1 yr IID upon app, AODA. Deferred Judgment agreement conditions reviewed. Atty Mehlos and Def agree. Plea quest. reviewed. Court grants motion to amend ct 1 possession of controlled subst. 961.41(3g)(b) No contest plea. Court grants motion to dismiss/read in. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Mehlos satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of ct 1 poss of controlled substance. Defers entry of judgment. Agreement signed. If Def has complied will dismiss in one yr. 16TR148 - no contest plea. Court accepts and orders $895 fine and costs, 7 month revocation, 1 yr IID, AODA. Pmt plan. BAC .16. 16TR149 dismissed and consolidated. 16CF26 - Court will hold cash bond until atty bill paid, if any extra, will be paid on OWI. If money still owed, will be added to pmt plan.  Review hearing scheduled for October 6, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Bond remains.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
